Great infographics, thanks :) Is there an up to date version (as this originates from 2015)?

For example, as  I type,  the current version of R is now 3.5.1 (Feather Spray) that was released in July 2018, and Python is 3.7.1 released just a few days ago on 20th October 2018.  The Python section also talks about iPython Notebooks, which have been superseded by Jupyter Notebooks, and laterly JupyterLab.  

Not a huge issue, just wondering if it has been, or is planned to be, updated.  Thanks Mark

A great idea for an article, and it looks pretty but definitely bring your salt grains with you while reading this.

From the summary: "Any piece of functionality is always written the same way in Python." - This is an obviously false statement. Come on now. It's a programming language. 

I feel like there should be a theorem "Any sufficiently nontrivial programming language has two different ways to achieve the same effect."

Very detailed and practical analysis. R stylesheets are more usable than I thought and never used to use it as often as I should have.  It is encouraging to see R finding a solid foothold in the enterprise market.
